isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL® VT 365 DIESEL ENGINE - IN-CHASSIS PROCEDURES - Rocker Arm

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the engine has cooled before removing components.

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

note.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or bodies of water.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, always disconnect main negative battery cable first. Always connect the main negative battery cable last.

note.para: Before doing the rocker arm removal procedure below, remove the following components:

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, insert clean shop towels (see TSI-02-12-16) or piece of rubber hose into oil drain holes in rocker arm carrier before removing fuel injectors. This will ensure that the following parts or pieces of these parts will not fall into the oil supply:

item.para: Rocker arm pivots and pivot retainers

note.para: Account for all parts or pieces, before removing shop towels or rubber hoses after rocker arms have been replaced.

step1.para: Find dowel hole in vibration damper between two of the four bolt heads.

figure.caption: Figure 511. Dowel hole in vibration damper

step1.para: Rotate crankshaft to position dowel hole at 12:00.
Wiggle both rocker arms for cylinder 1.

item.para: If rocker arms feel free of valve train loading, the valves are completely closed. Rocker arms can be serviced for cylinders 1, 2, 7, and 8.
If rocker arms do not feel free, rotate crankshaft (360°) to put crankshaft in the correct position. Rocker arms can be serviced for cylinders 1, 2, 7, and 8.

figure.caption: Figure 512. Engine harness connector to injector connector

step1.para: Push in the spring loaded clip in the engine harness connector to the fuel injector connector and remove engine harness connector.
Install the Injector Connector Release Tool .
Push Injector Connector Release Tool to pop loose spring clips on the injector connector and remove connector from the rocker arm carrier.

figure.caption: Figure 514. Fuel Injector Hold Down Wrench
Figure 515. Removal of fuel injector hold down clamp

step1.para: Remove the fuel injector hold down clamp assembly, using the Fuel Injector Hold Down Wrench .
Remove injector and place into injector cup.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, insert a clean paper towel inside injector sleeve to keep foreign material out.

figure.caption: Figure 516. On-engine Valve Spring Compressor Tool
Figure 517. Old fuel injector hold down clamp assembly
Figure 518. New fuel injector hold down clamp assembly
Figure 519. Hold down clamp and valve spring compressor base

step1.para: Install On-engine Valve Spring Compressor Tool .
Insert valve spring compressor base into a new injector hold down clamp. Make sure the notch in the valve spring compressor base aligns with the alignment index tab on hold down clamp.

calloutgroup.callout1: Valve spring compressor base and hold down clamp

step1.para: Install new hold down clamp and valve spring compressor base between valve bridges.

note.para: While centering base between the two valve bridges, lightly tighten hold down bolt, but do not torque.

figure.caption: Figure 521. Clearance between rocker arm and valve bridge

step1.para: Install valve spring compressor plate onto top of valve bridge, inserting small point of plate between the exhaust rocker and valve bridge.

note.para: If exhaust rocker is severely worn, insert a small pry bar between the exhaust rocker arm and valve bridge. Compress the valve bridge down to raise the rocker for enough clearance to rotate the small point of the compressor plate between the two components.

figure.caption: Figure 522. Valve spring compressor plate installed

step1.para: Once compressor plate is in position, install valve spring compressor bolt through plate and into valve spring compressor base.
Using a hand wrench, tighten bolt to compress valve springs until plate contacts top of valve spring compressor base.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not use power tools.

step1.para: Disengage rocker arm from push rod, while rotating rocker arm and compressing rocker arm clip simultaneously.
Remove rocker arm and retaining clip.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, account for two 3/8" rocker arm pivot balls. If balls fall onto cylinder head, retrieve balls with a magnet.
To prevent engine damage, account for each rocker arm pivot and pivot retainer. Failure to account for broken pieces requires removal of oil pan to retrieve.

figure.caption: Figure 523. Damaged rocker arm pivot and retainer

step1.para: With rocker arms removed, back out valve spring compressor bolt and remove valve spring compressor plate to access valve bridges.
